reviewText:
I've been trying to see this movie ever since I was a child (1957).  I was enamored by it then and I still am in a different way.  Thank you amazon for having it available after all these years.

Albert
Sweetest movie I ever saw! Only trouble I have is did they cut out a Dennis Morgan song? It is in the trailer but not the film!!
An old old favorite from yesteryear
just like movies about earlier times and like the stars in this particular movie
Good old movie and full of fun

This charming musical film had me smiling all the way through.  No boffo song hits but the music is thoroughly entertaining with nice low key presentations.  The story unfolds in a clever manner with serious topics handled openly but with humor.  The 1890's and turn of the century sets and costumes capture the feel of the age as we usually romanticize it to be.  The acting is even keeled, not distracting other than as one might expect it to be.  I particularly enjoyed the physical comedy and dance of Ben Blue.  Fun time for those who can get in the spirit of the movie.
Although the original is best, this was a good re-make and I like to have the originals and all re-makes in my personal film library.

Take me back to a simple place and time with some good old fashioned values, a lesson learned in what goes around, comes around and some good harmony to go along with it and you got One Sunday Afternoon - A classic that I don't mind watching over and over again!
Classic Victorian -American costuming and sets  Music was great too. Comical  in script and in the aspect of the time it was filmed.
